name: Adder
desc: An abstract class for all adder module.

name: Adder
desc:
Takes in input a and input b and return the sum of the addition
result. The width of input a and b must be the same.

name: a
desc: The input to the adder pin a.

name: b
desc: The input to the adder pin b.

name: sum
desc: The addition results in 2s complement form as sum

name: ApbCompleterAgent
desc: A model for the completer side of an ApbInterface.

name: ApbCompleterAgent
desc: Creates a new model ApbCompleterAgent.

name: dropWriteDataOnError
desc:
If true, then writes that respond with an error will not store into the
storage.

name: intf
desc: The interface to drive.

name: invalidReadDataOnError
desc: If true, then returned data on an error will be x.

name: respondWithError
desc:
A function that determines whether a response for a request should contain
an error (slvErr).

name: responseDelay
desc: A function which delays the response for the given request.

name: run
desc: Executes this Component's activities related to running the test.

name: selectIndex
desc: The index that this is listening to on the intf.

name: storage
desc: A place where the completer should save and retrieve data.

name: ApbComplianceChecker
desc: A checker for some of the rules defined in the APB interface specification.

name: ApbComplianceChecker
desc: Creates a new compliance checker for intf.

name: intf
desc: The interface being checked.

name: run
desc: Executes this Component's activities related to running the test.

name: ApbDirection
desc: A grouping of signals on the ApbInterface interface based on direction.

name: values
desc: A constant List of the values in this enum, in order of their declaration.

name: ApbInterface
desc: A standard APB interface.

name: ApbInterface
desc: Construct a new instance of an APB interface.

name: aUser
desc: User request attribute.

name: addr
desc: Address bus.

name: addrWidth
desc: The width of address port addr.

name: bUser
desc: User response attribute.

name: clk
desc: Clock for the interface.

name: ApbInterface.clone
desc: Constructs a new ApbInterface with identical parameters to other.

name: dataWidth
desc: The width of data ports wData and rData;

name: enable
desc: Enable.

name: includeSlvErr
desc: If true, generates the slvErr port.

name: includeWakeup
desc: If true, indicates that this interface supports wake-up.

name: nse
desc: Extension to protection type.

name: numSelects
desc: The number of select signals on this interface.

name: prot
desc: Protection type.

name: rData
desc: Read data.

name: rUser
desc: User read data attribute.

name: ready
desc: Ready.

name: resetN
desc: Reset signal (active LOW).

name: sel
desc: Select.

name: slvErr
desc: Transfer error.

name: strb
desc: Write strobe.

name: userDataWidth
desc: The width of user-defined data ports wUser and rUser.

name: userReqWidth
desc: The width of user request port aUser.

name: userRespWidth
desc: The width of user response port bUser.

name: wData
desc: Write data.

name: wUser
desc: User write data attribute.

name: wakeup
desc: Wake-up.

name: write
desc: Direction.

name: ApbMonitor
desc: A monitor for ApbInterfaces.

name: ApbMonitor
desc: Creates a new ApbMonitor on intf.

name: intf
desc: The interface to monitor.

name: run
desc: Executes this Component's activities related to running the test.

name: ApbPacket
desc: A packet on an ApbInterface.

name: ApbPacket
desc: Creates a new packet.

name: addr
desc: The address for this packet.

name: complete
desc: Called by a completer when a transfer is completed.

name: completed
desc: A Future that completes once the the read has been completed.

name: returnedSlvErr
desc: Error indication returned by the read.

name: selectIndex
desc: The index of the select this packet should be driven on.

name: trackerString
desc: Returns a formatted String value associated with field in this object.

name: ApbReadPacket
desc: A read packet on an ApbInterface.

name: ApbReadPacket
desc: Creates a read packet.

name: complete
desc: Called by a completer when a transfer is completed.

name: returnedData
desc: Data returned by the read.

name: trackerString
desc: Returns a formatted String value associated with field in this object.

name: ApbRequesterAgent
desc: An agent for sending requests on an ApbInterface.

name: ApbRequesterAgent
desc: Constructs a new ApbRequesterAgent.

name: driver
desc: The driver that sends the requests over the interface.

name: dropDelayCycles
desc:
The number of cycles before an objection will be dropped when there are
no pending packets to send.

name: intf
desc: The interface to drive.

name: sequencer
desc: The sequencer where requests should be sent.

name: timeoutCycles
desc: The number of cycles before timing out if no transactions can be sent.

name: ApbRequesterDriver
desc: A driver for the ApbInterface from the requester side.

name: ApbRequesterDriver
desc: Creates a new ApbRequesterDriver.

name: intf
desc: The interface to drive.

name: run
desc: Executes this Component's activities related to running the test.

name: ApbTracker
desc: A tracker for the ApbInterface.

name: ApbTracker
desc: Creates a new tracker for ApbInterface.

name: addrField
desc: Tracker field for address.

name: dataField
desc: Tracker field for data.

name: selectField
desc: Tracker field for select.

name: slverrField
desc: Tracker field for errors.

name: strobeField
desc: Tracker field for strobe.

name: timeField
desc: Tracker field for simulation time.

name: typeField
desc: Tracker field for type (R/W).

name: ApbWritePacket
desc: A write packet on an ApbInterface.

name: ApbWritePacket
desc: Creates a write packet.

name: data
desc: The data for this packet.

name: strobe
desc: The strobe associated with this write.

name: trackerString
desc: Returns a formatted String value associated with field in this object.

name: Arbiter
desc: An abstract description of an arbiter module.

name: Arbiter
desc:
Constructs an arbiter where each element in requests is a one-bit signal
requesting a corresponding bit from grants.

name: count
desc: The total number of requests and grants for this Arbiter.

name: grants
desc:
Each element corresponds to an arbitration grant of the correspondingly
indexed request passed at construction time.

name: requests
desc: Each element is the input pin for the correspondingly indexed request.

name: BinaryToGrayConverter
desc: A module for converting binary values to Gray code representation.

name: BinaryToGrayConverter
desc:
Creates a BinaryToGrayConverter instance with the specified binary
input.

name: binaryToGray
desc: Converts a binary value represented by binary to Gray code.

name: gray
desc: The Gray code representation output of the converter.

name: BinaryToOneHot
desc: Encodes a binary number into one-hot.

name: BinaryToOneHot
desc:
Constructs a Module which encodes a 2's complement number binary
into a one-hot, or thermometer code

name: encoded
desc: The encoded one-hot result.

name: BitCompressor
desc: Construct a column compressor

name: carry
desc: The carry results carry.

name: compressBits
desc: Input bits to compress

name: sum
desc: The addition results sum including carry bit

Bitonic Sort is a pipelined sort module that sort toSort to
specified order based on isAscending.

name: latency
desc: The latency of the bitonic sort algorithm.

name: sorted

name: createModule
desc: Creates a Module instance as configured.

name: isAscendingKnob
desc: A knob controlling whether to sort in ascending (or descending) order.

desc:
A mapping from configuration names to ConfigKnobs that can be used
to configure this component.

name: lengthOfListKnob
desc: A knob controlling the number of items to sort.

name: logicWidthKnob
desc: A knob controlling the width of each element to sort.

desc: The name of this Configurator.

desc: BrentKung constructor

name: CarrySaveMultiplier
desc: A binary multiplier using carry-save technique with pipelining.

desc: Construct a CarrySaveMultiplier that multiply input a and input b.

name: latency
desc: The latency of the carry save multiplier.

name: product
desc: The final product of the multiplier module.

name: CarrySaveMultiplierConfigurator

A mapping from configuration names to ConfigKnobs that can be used

name: CarrySelectCompoundAdder
desc: Carry-select compound adder.

name: CarrySelectCompoundAdder
desc: Constructs a CarrySelectCompoundAdder.

name: splitSelectAdderAlgorithm4Bit
desc:
Adder ripple-carry block size computation algorithm.
Generates 4 bit carry-select blocks with 1st entry width adjusted down.
Return list of carry-ripple block sizes starting from
the LSB connected one.
adderWidth is a whole width of adder.

name: splitSelectAdderAlgorithmSingleBlock
desc:
Adder ripple-carry block size computation algorithm.
Generates only one carry-select block
Return list of carry-ripple block sizes starting from
the LSB connected one.
adderWidth is a whole width of adder.

name: CaseOneHotToBinary
desc: Decodes a one-hot number into binary using a case block.

name: CaseOneHotToBinary
desc:
Constructs a Module which decodes a one-hot number onehot into a 2s
complement number binary by encoding the position of the '1' using a
Case block.

name: ChoiceConfigKnob

Creates a new knob to with the specified default value of the available
choices.

desc: The available choices to choose from.

desc: Reconfigures this knob based on the provided deserialized JSON.

desc: Serializes this knob into a JSON-compatible map.

name: ColumnQueue

Takes in input a and input b and return the sum of the addition
result and sum1 sum + 1.

desc: Serializes this knob into a JSON-compatible map.

name: Configurator
desc:
An object that enables a consisten API for configuring a Module and
performing common tasks with it.

name: createModule
desc: Creates a Module instance as configured.

name: generateSV
desc: Generates SystemVerilog for the module as configured.

name: knobs
desc:
A mapping from configuration names to ConfigKnobs that can be used
to configure this component.

name: loadJson
desc: Loads the configuration from a serialized JSON representation.

name: name
desc: The name of this Configurator.

desc:
A version of the name which has been sanitized to meet SystemVerilog
variable naming requirements.

name: toJson
desc: Serializes the configuration information into a JSON structure.

name: Count
desc: Count 1 or 0.

name: Count
desc: Count 1 or 0.

name: index
desc: index is an getter for output of Count

name: Counter
desc:
Keeps a count of the running sum of any number of sources with optional
configuration for widths, saturation behavior, and restarting.

name: Counter
desc: Creates a counter that increments according to the provided interfaces.

name: count
desc: The output value of the counter.

name: equalsMax
desc:
Indicates whether the sum (including potential saturation) is currently
equal to the maximum.

name: equalsMin
desc:
Indicates whether the sum (including potential saturation) is currently
equal to the minimum.

name: initialValueLogic
desc: An internal Logic version of the provided initial value.

name: interfaces
desc: The "internal" versions of the SumInterfaces for this computation.

name: maxValueLogic
desc: An internal Logic version of the provided maximum value.

name: minValueLogic
desc: An internal Logic version of the provided minimum value.

name: Counter.ofLogics
desc:
Creates a Counter that counts up by all of the provided logics,
including much of the other available configuration in the default
constructor.

name: overflowed
desc:
Indicates whether the sum is greater than the maximum value. The actual
resulting value depends on the provided saturates behavior (staturation
or overflow).

name: saturates
desc:
If true, will saturate at the maxValue and minValue. If false,
will wrap around (overflow/underflow) at the maxValue and minValue.

name: Counter.simple
desc:
A simplified constructor for Counter that accepts a single fixed amount
to count by (up or down based on increments) along with much of the
other available configuration in the default Counter constructor.

name: underflowed
desc:
Indicates whether the sum is less than the minimum value. The actual
resulting value depends on the provided saturates behavior (saturation
or underflow).

name: width
desc: The width of the resulting sum.

name: CounterConfigurator
desc: A configurator for Counter.

name: createModule
desc: Creates a Module instance as configured.

A mapping from configuration names to ConfigKnobs that can be used
to configure this component.

desc: The name of this Configurator.

desc: The reset value.

name: DataPortInterface
desc: An interface to a simple memory that only needs enable, address, and data.

name: DataPortInterface
desc:
Constructs a new interface of specified dataWidth and addrWidth for
interacting with a memory in either the read or write direction.

name: addr
desc: The "address" bit for a request when en is high.

name: addrWidth
desc: The width of addresses in the memory.

name: clone
desc: Makes a copy of this Interface with matching configuration.

name: data
desc: The data sent or received with the associated request.

name: dataWidth
desc: The width of data in the memory.

name: en
desc: The "enable" bit for this interface, enabling a request.

name: Deserializer
desc: Deserializer aggregates data from a serialized stream.

name: Deserializer
desc:
Build a Deserializer that takes serialized input serialized
and aggregates it into one wide output deserialized of length length.

name: count
desc: Return the current count of elements that have been serialized out.

name: deserialized
desc: Aggregated data output.

name: done
desc:
done emitted when the last element is committed to deserialized.
The timing is that you can latch deserialized when done is high.

name: length
desc: Length of aggregate to deserialize.

desc: A knob controlling the HammingType.

name: EdgeDetector

An edge detector for positive, negative, or any edge on a signal relative to
the previous clock cycle.

Creates an edge detector which flags an edge when signal changes
relative to its value in the previous cycle.

name: edge
desc: High for one cycle when the input signal has an edgeType transition.

name: edgeType
desc: The type of edge(s) to detect.

desc: A Configurator for EdgeDetector.

name: edgeTypeKnob

A mapping from configuration names to ConfigKnobs that can be used
to configure this component.

name: ErrorCheckingReceiver
desc:
A receiver for data which includes a code for checking and possibly
correcting.

name: ErrorCheckingReceiver
desc: Creates a receiver for transmission.

name: calculateCorrectableError
desc: Implementation to calculate whether something is a correctableError.

name: calculateCorrectedData
desc: Implementation to calculate corrected data, if supported.

name: calculateUncorrectableError
desc: Implementation to calculate whether something is an uncorrectableError.

name: code
desc:
The code included in the transmitted bus which is used to check for and
handle errors.

name: correctableError
desc: Whether there was a correctable error.

name: correctedData
desc: The originalData with any possible corrections applied.

name: error
desc: Whether or not there was an error (correctable or uncorrectable).

name: originalData
desc: The original data before any correction.

name: supportsErrorCorrection
desc: Whether or not data correction is supported.

name: transmission
desc: The input port bus provied to this receiver.

name: uncorrectableError
desc: Whether there was an uncorrectable error.

name: ErrorCheckingTransmitter
desc:
A transmitter for data which includes a code for checking and possibly
correcting data at the receiving end.

name: ErrorCheckingTransmitter
desc: Creates a transmitter for data.

name: calculateCode
desc:
Generates the code to be provided by the transmitter, to be implemented by
implementations.

name: code
desc: The code that in addition to original data that enables error detection.

name: data
desc: The input port data provied to this transmitter.

name: transmission
desc: The full bus to transmit including the original data and the code.

name: Extrema
desc: Determines the extremas (maximum or minimum) of a List<Logic>.

name: Extrema
desc:
Finds an extrema of List<Logic> signals. Inputs need not be the same
width, and will all be considered positive unsigned numbers.

name: index
desc: The index of the extrema.

name: val
desc: The val of the extrema.

name: Fifo
desc: A simple FIFO (First In, First Out).

name: Fifo
desc: Constructs a FIFO with RF-based storage.

name: dataWidth
desc: The width of the data transmitted through this FIFO.

name: depth
desc: The depth of this FIFO.

name: empty
desc: High if there is nothing in the FIFO.

name: error
desc: High if an error condition is reached.

name: full
desc: High if the entire FIFO is full and it cannot accept any more new items.

name: generateBypass
desc:
If true, then it is possible to bypass through the FIFO by writing
and reading at the same time while empty.

name: generateError
desc: If true, then the error output will be generated.

name: generateOccupancy
desc: If true, then the occupancy output will be generated.

name: occupancy
desc: The number of items in the FIFO.

name: readData
desc: Read data for the next item in the FIFO.

name: FifoChecker
desc:
A checker for Fifos that they are being used properly and not reaching any
dangerous conditions.

name: FifoChecker
desc: Builds a checker for a fifo.

name: check
desc: Performs additional checks at the end of the simulation.

name: enableEndOfTestEmptyCheck
desc: If true, will check that fifo is empty at the end of the test.

name: enableOverflowCheck
desc: If true, will flag an error if there is an overflow in the fifo.

name: enableUnderflowCheck
desc: If true, will flag an error if there is an underflow in the fifo.

name: fifo
desc: The Fifo being checked.

name: FifoConfigurator
desc: A Configurator for Fifo.

desc: A knob controlling the generation of bypass functionality.

name: FloatingPointValue
desc:
A flexible representation of floating point values.
A FloatingPointValue hasa mantissa in [0,2) with
0 <= exponent <= maxExponent();  A normal isNormal FloatingPointValue
has minExponent() <= exponent <= maxExponent() and a mantissa in the
range of [1,2).  Subnormal numbers are represented with a zero exponent
and leading zeros in the mantissa capture the negative exponent value.

name: operator *
desc: Multiply operation for FloatingPointValue

name: operator +
desc: Addition operation for FloatingPointValue

name: operator -
desc: Subtract operation for FloatingPointValue

name: operator /
desc: Divide operation for FloatingPointValue

name: operator ==
desc: Return the bias of this FP format

name: FloatingPointValue
desc:
Factory (static) constructor of a FloatingPointValue from
sign, mantissa and exponent

name: abs
desc: Absolute value operation for FloatingPointValue

name: bias
desc: Return the bias of this FloatingPointValue.

name: compareTo
desc: Floating point comparison to implement Comparable<>

name: computeBias
desc:
Return the exponent value representing the true zero exponent 2^0 = 1
often termed computeBias or the offset of the exponent

name: computeMaxExponent
desc: Return the maximum exponent value

name: computeMinExponent
desc: Return the minimum exponent value

name: exponent
desc:
The exponent of the floating point: this is biased about a midpoint for
positive and negative exponents

name: FloatingPointValue.fromDouble
desc: Convert from double using its native binary representation

name: FloatingPointValue.fromDoubleIter
desc:
Convert a floating point number into a FloatingPointValue
representation. This form performs NO ROUNDING.

name: FloatingPointValue.fromLogic
desc: Construct a FloatingPointValue from a Logic word

name: FloatingPointValue.getFloatingPointConstant
desc: Return the FloatingPointValue representing the constant specified

name: isNaN
desc:
Return true if the represented floating point number is considered
NaN or 'Not a Number' due to overflow

name: isNormal
desc:
Return a Logic true if this FloatingPointVa;ie contains a normal number,
defined as having mantissa in the range [1,2)

name: mantissa
desc: The mantissa of the floating point

name: maxExponent
desc: Return the maximum exponent of this FloatingPointValue.

name: minExponent
desc: Return the minimum exponent of this FloatingPointValue.

name: negate
desc: Negate operation for FloatingPointValue

name: FloatingPointValue.ofBigInts
desc:
FloatingPointValue constructor from a set of BigInts of the binary
representation and the size of the exponent and mantissa

desc:
FloatingPointValue constructor from a binary string representation of

name: FloatingPointValue.ofInts
desc:
FloatingPointValue constructor from a set of ints of the binary

name: FloatingPointValue.ofSeparatedBinaryStrings
desc:
FloatingPointValue constructor from a single binary string representing
space-separated bitfields

name: FloatingPointValue.ofString
desc:
FloatingPointValue constructor from a radix-encoded string
representation and the size of the exponent and mantissa

name: FloatingPointValue.random
desc:
Generate a random FloatingPointValue, supplying random seed rv.
This generates a valid FloatingPointValue anywhere in the range
it can represent:a general FloatingPointValue has
a mantissa in [0,2) with 0 <= exponent <= maxExponent();
If normal is true, This routine will only generate mantissas in the
range of [1,2) and minExponent() <= exponent <= maxExponent().

name: sign
desc: The sign of the value:  1 means a negative value

name: toDouble
desc: Return the value of the floating point number in a Dart double type.

name: toString
desc:
Return a string representation of FloatingPointValue.
if integer is true, return sign, exponent, mantissa as integers.
if integer is false, return sign, exponent, mantissa as ibinary strings.

name: value
desc: The full floating point value bit storage

A receiver for transmissions sent with a Hamming code for error detection

Type of Hamming code, with different characteristics for error correction,

name: hasExtraParityBit

name: LogicList
desc: Helper evaluation methods for printing aligned arithmetic bitvectors.

name: listString
desc:
Print aligned bitvector with an optional header from List.
name is printed at the LHS of the line, trimmed by prefix.
prefix is the distance from the margin bebore the vector is printed.
alignHigh is highest column (MSB) to which to align
alignLow will trim the vector below this bit position (LSB).
shift will allow you to shift your list positions
You can insert a separator sepChar at position sepPos.
A header can be printed by setting header to true.
Markdown format can be produced by setting markDown to true.
The output can have space by setting extraSpace
if intValue is true, then the integer value (signed version in parens)
will be printed at the end of the vector.

name: bitString
desc: Simplest version of bit string representation as shorthand

name: majority
desc: Compute the unary majority on LogicValue

name: MaskRoundRobinArbiter

Round Robin arbiter handles requests by granting each requestor
and keeping record of requests already granted, in order to mask it until
granting the turn of each request to start again

name: mask

A bus controlling the mask, where each bit cooresponds to one
byte of data.  A high bit is an enable for that chunk of data.

A model of a Memory which uses a software-based SparseMemoryStorage to

name: addrWidth

name: dataWidth
desc: The width of data.

name: getData
desc: Returns the data at addr, or null if it is not present.

name: invalidWrite
desc:
Triggers behavior associated with an invalid write, including calling
onInvalidWrite and resetting all of memory.

name: isEmpty
desc: Returns true if there is no data stored in this memory.

desc: Reads a verilog-compliant hex file and preloads memory with it.

name: onInvalidRead
desc: A function called if a read is made to an address that has no data.

name: onInvalidWrite
desc: A function called if an invalid write is made when not isEmpty.

name: readData
desc:
Aligns the address with alignAddress, then returns either the getData
result in storage or else onInvalidRead's result.

name: reset
desc: Resets all memory to initial state.

name: setData
desc: Loads data into addr directly into storage.

name: writeData
desc:
Performs some validation on a write, aligns the address with
alignAddress, and then calls setData.

An adder (and subtractor) OnesComplementAdder that operates on

name: OnesComplementAdder
desc:
OnesComplementAdder constructor with an adder functor adderGen
Either a Logic subtractIn or a boolean subtract can enable
subtraction, with subtractIn overriding subtract.  If Logic carryOut
is provided as not null, then the end-around carry is not performed and is
left to the caller via the output carryOut.

name: carryOut
desc:
The end-around carry which should be added to the resulting sum
If the input carryOut is not null, this value is stored there.
 Otherwise, the end-around carry is internally added to sum

name: sign
desc: The sign of the result

name: ParallelPrefix
desc:
ParallelPrefix is the core parallel prefix tree structure node
The output is a List of multi-bit Logic vectors (typically 2-bit) that
represent things like carry-save or generate-propagate signaling in adder
networks.  Each node in a parallel prefix tree transforms a row of inputs
to an equal length row of outputs of these multi-bit Logic values.

desc: ParallePrefix recursion

desc: Output sequence value

Constructs a Module which checks data that has been transmitted with
correct parity. This will split the transmitted data in transmission
into 2 parts: the originalData, and the error bit upon which error is
calculated for parity error checking.

checkError is an getter for parity result with 0 for success and 1

Generates the code to be provided by the transmitter, to be implemented by

name: parity

name: PartialProductGenerator

A PartialProductGenerator class that generates a set of partial products.
 Essentially a set of
shifted rows of Logic addends generated by Booth recoding and
manipulated by sign extension, before being compressed

desc: Construct a PartialProductGenerator -- the partial product matrix

Return the List at the
absolute position (row, List columns.

Set the values of the row, starting at absolute position (row, col)

name: multiplicand

Mux the Logic at absolute position (row, col) conditionally by

Mux the range of values into the row starting at absolute position

Partial Products output. Generated by selector and extended by sign

desc:
The actual shift in each row. This value will be modified by the

row

Selector for the multiplicand which uses the encoder to index into

name: setAbsoluteAll
desc: Set the range at absolute position (row, col) to list.

Sign extend the PP array using stop bits without adding a row

an extension of Mohanty, B.K., Choubey designed by
Desmond A. Kirkpatrick

name: RippleCarryAdder
desc:
An RippleCarryAdder is a digital circuit used for binary addition. It
consists of a series of full adders connected in a chain, with the carry
output of each adder linked to the carry input of the next one. Starting
from the least significant bit (LSB) to most significant bit (MSB), the
adder sequentially adds corresponding bits of two binary numbers.

name: RippleCarryAdder
desc: Constructs an n-bit adder based on inputs List of inputs.

desc: A Configurator for RippleCarryAdder.

name: Serializer
desc: Serializes wide aggregated data onto a narrower serialization stream.

name: Serializer
desc:
Build a Serializer that takes the array deserialized and sequences it
onto the serialized output.

name: count
desc:
The number of current serialization steps completed in the
transfer is count.

name: done
desc:
Return done = true when we have processed deserializedcompletely.
done is asserted with the final element being serialized so that
at the next clock edge, you have done with the last element latched at
the same time.

name: serialized
desc: Serialized output, one data item per clock.

name: ShiftRegister
desc:
A shift register with configurable width and depth and optional enable and
reset.

name: ShiftRegister
desc:
Creates a new shift register with specified depth which is only active
when enabled. If reset is provided, it will reset synchronously with
clk or aynchronously if asyncReset is true. The reset will reset all
stages to a default of 0 or to the provided resetValue.
If resetValue is a List the stages will reset to the corresponding
value in the list.

name: dataName
desc: The name of the data, used for naming the ports and Module.

name: dataOut
desc: The main output of the shift register after going through all the stages.

name: depth
desc: The number of stages in this shift register.

name: stages
desc:
A List of outputs where the n'th entry corresponds to a version of
the input data after passing through n + 1 flops.

name: width
desc: The width of the data passing through this shfit register.

name: SignBit
desc: Store a Signbit as Logic

name: SignBit
desc: Construct a sign bit to store

name: inverted
desc: This is an inverted sign bit

name: SignMagnitudeAdder
desc: A SignMagnitudeAdder performsa addition on values in sign/magnitude format.

name: SignMagnitudeAdder
desc:
SignMagnitudeAdder constructor with an adder functor adderGen
Inputs are (sign, magnitude) pairs: (aSign, a) and (bSign, b).
If the caller can guarantee that the larger magnitude value
 is provided first in a, then they can set largestMagnitudeFirst
too 'true' to avoid a comparator.

name: aSign
desc: The sign of the first input

name: bSign
desc: The sign of the second input

name: largestMagnitudeFirst
desc:
Largest magnitude argument is provided in a or if equal
the argument with a negative sign.

name: sign
desc: The sign of the result

name: Sum
desc:
Computes a sum of any number of sources with optional configuration for
widths and saturation behavior.

name: Sum
desc: Computes a sum across the provided interfaces.

name: equalsMax
desc:
Indicates whether the sum (including potential saturation) is currently
equal to the maximum.

name: equalsMin
desc:
Indicates whether the sum (including potential saturation) is currently
equal to the minimum.

name: initialValueLogic
desc: An internal Logic version of the provided initial value.

name: interfaces
desc: The "internal" versions of the SumInterfaces for this computation.

name: maxValueLogic
desc: An internal Logic version of the provided maximum value.

name: minValueLogic
desc: An internal Logic version of the provided minimum value.

name: Sum.ofLogics
desc: Computes a Sum across the provided logics.

name: overflowed
desc:
Indicates whether the sum is greater than the maximum value. The actual
resulting value depends on the provided saturates behavior (staturation
or overflow).

name: saturates
desc:
If true, will saturate at the maxValue and minValue. If false,
will wrap around (overflow/underflow) at the maxValue and minValue.

name: sum
desc: The resulting sum.

name: underflowed
desc:
Indicates whether the sum is less than the minimum value. The actual
resulting value depends on the provided saturates behavior (saturation
or underflow).

name: width
desc: The width of the resulting sum.

name: SumConfigurator
desc: A configurator for Sum.

A PairInterface representing an amount and behavior for inclusion in a

name: SumInterface.clone

name: enable

Controls whether it should increment or decrement (based on increments)
(active high).

name: fixedAmount
desc: If non-null, the constant value of amount.

name: hasEnable
desc: Whether an enable signal is present on this interface.

name: increments
desc: If true, will increment. If false,  will decrement.

name: width
desc: The width of the amount.

name: widthKnob
